title: Stupid message, broken shortcut and broken repair
body:
Every time I launch League, I get the annoying message that tells me:
"""
League of Legends will now update your
desktop shortcuts. Your operating system may
ask for Administrator permissions.
"""

After having clicked "OK" over a hundred times, I'm really annoyed by this message for two main reasons:
1 - I am already adminstrator with UAC disabled so I won't receive a message from my OS anyway
2 - I don't have any League desktop shortcut!

So I tried the impossible to get this damned message to disappear: I tried creating a desktop shortcut.
So "Desktop\Play League of Legends.lnk" -> "P:\LoL\lol.launcher.exe" (yes, that's where it is installed)
I lauched the game, pressed "OK" and looked at the new shortcut:
"Desktop\Play League of Legends.lnk" -> "P:\LoL\LeagueClient.exe" (which **does not exist**)
So I looked online and saw people telling me to launch a full repair. I found the option after clicking "Launch", in the settings named "Initiate full repair".
Launching that crashes immediately with a bugsplat.
I then found the other repair option, under "?" before clicking "Launch", and repaired my client.

This did not change anything. (The "Full repair" still bugsplats, the "shortcut update" still creates a **broken shortcut** to LeagueClient.exe and that file still doesn't exist).
I can still play, but cannot get rid of that **stupid message**. Any clue on what is wrong on my installation? Do you even have a .exe other than lol.launcher.exe and lol.launcher.admin.exe in the League installation directory? What is your desktop shortcut pointing to?

Thank you in advance.
Camusensei


Context:
- W7 x64 with admin rights
- I'm posting here because every time I tried to contact the support in the past, they would always tell me: "please ask your question in the boards/forum"...

replies.body:
Alright, reinstalling worked:
I now no longer have to click "launch" at the beginning nor "OK" for that message I described earlier.
And my LoL installation folder no longer looks the same AT ALL.
Instead of just
Config/
Logs/
RADS/
lol.launcher.exe
lol.launcher.admin.exe,
I have now the same folders but a lot of .dll files plus the LeagueClient.exe and some other exe files. So I wonder what happened when the automatic update kicked in but surely not what was expected.

Thank you again for your help Porocles.

Regards,
Camusensei

Hello.

I finally gave it a try... and it fails at the very beginning.. It tells me to select LeagueClient.exe which does not exist!!! Well, it technically does exist in subfolders (RADS/solutions/league_client_sln/releases/0.0.0.70/deploy/ RADS/projects/league_client/releases/installer/deploy/
and RADS/projects/league_client/releases/0.0.0.100/deploy/) but selecting one of those makes the hextech repair tool crash.

I finally copied one of them in the root LoL folder, to prevent it from crashing. I wonder if I'm the only one in such a bizzare situation...
I launched a full reinstall because I have nothing to lose. Will then create a support ticket as advised if that stupid message is still there after the reinstall.

Thank you for your help Porocles!

Regards,
Camusensei

It definitely sounds like something like an anti-virus or OS setting is not allowing your league files to be accessed or read.  Trying some admin and UAC steps is good, but go over each step of the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide for some more options.

Should all fail, grab our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to to get some logs, and attach them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team will be able to get more context and help you directly with this.
